OK, I thoroughly tried and tested all options, reinstalled the game several times, tried copying only some files of the crack (I tried all combinations) and I still get the Skidrow window. I tried pressing every single key on the keyboard, pressing them with SHIFT, CTRL and ALT held down, clicking the mouse at various spots, both buttons + wheel. Nothing happened at all. The only thing I noticed is that the animation in the skidrow window freezes when you press F10. It unfreezes when you press anything else or F10 again.

If you try to run the game without the crack, nothing executes at all. Not even any window asking for activation/whatever.

Still, I don't think this is a fake release. I think the most probable possibility is that the developers fucked up. I'm sure that when you close the skidrow window by pressing ESC, the game is supposed to run. However, it doesn't do so - nothing happens.

If you DON'T apply the crack - nothing happens as well.

I think there's some bug in the game that prevents the game from even starting on most machines. Since some people were able to get it to work, it's obviously a hardware specific bug but a major one.

Saying that people should update their drivers or learn to install is bullshit. Installing this game (or any game) is extremely easy, the setup makes everything noob-friendly. Copying the crack is simply Copy&Paste that anybody can do. And outdated drivers might cause some game problems but they have nothing to do with the game not starting at all.

I'll try to look for some more info about this issue and get back to you if I learn anything.

I've downloaded many skidrow releases over the years, and they have never, ever, had a cracktro in the game .exe, never mind the fact that this is also the first time my AV's told me there was a virus present in a scene release, and I've been downloading releases for decades. 

Why would skidrow suddenly incorporate a cracktro, when they didn't do so for their last release, darksiders 2? I've never had a scene crack make my AV go off either, and honestly, turning your AV off might be the stupidest thing to do at this point.

If I were any of you, I would definitely not disable my AV and wait for a proper, if this even is a real skidrow release, which I doubt.

For everyone who thinks the people who upload software are in any way obligated to serve you you are mistaken! When you DL software from us you are recieving said product free of charge and also free of any kind of support if you cant get it working it's on YOU not us when there is a problem with something you've DL'd either wait for a fix or go pay for the authorized version! Dont complain about how any of us need to serve you or your problems it is a voluntary service uploading these applications and you have no right to any type of support for these products! With that said soon there (hopefully) be a process put into effect which will ban all access to any files from various sites to those users who continue to harass, offend, or in any way disrespect the kind and generous users who work so hard and long to offer these costly and expensive titles to the less fortunate or less accessible of us! You can either accept that maybe 1 out of every 20 DL's may have a glitch which keeps them from running on some or all of the CPU systems out there or you can live without the other 20 that do work! Just be happy that these sites exist at all and show some degree of appreciation for all the titles you have already DL'd and enjoyed from us and remember all of them when you get that one that doesnt work for you!!

OK, people. I finally managed to figure it all out. Point people on this comment, if they need help.

To get it working, you need to have Steam installed on your computer. You don't need to be logged in. However, here's the catch:
Steam MUST be installed in it's default folder (Program Files). If you install Steam in any different folder, the game will not launch at all.

Second thing - the scroll lock thing. If you have Scroll lock ON BEFORE you run the game, it will skip the Skidrow intro and show a message box that the intro has been skipped and to press OK to play the game. This works with the Spider-Man release as well. Pressing Scroll Lock AFTER the game was launched has no effect.

Now stop insulting each other and go play the game!

Ok guys, finally got this game working myself... I will say exactly how..  btw i already had steam installed to c:gamessteam on win7 64 bit.

this guide assumes you have steam installed in any other location other than the default.

1# install hitman sniper challenge
2# copy crack files
3# delete all files in your steam folder except the steamapps folder (to backup all your games) and Steam.exe
4# copy steam folder (contents should be steamapps folder and steam.exe) to c:programfiles (x86)
5# run steam, it will redownload needed files and update itself. login
6# add hmsc.exe to steam as a non-steam game.
7# play.

keep your antivirus and firewalls turned on, block hmsc.exe access with firewall

if your on 32bit, then use c:programfilessteam
if your on 64bit, then use c:programfiles (x86)steam

Confirming this does work, problem seems to be a filepath for something is hardcoded.

update to my previous comment.

you don't event need to add hmsc.exe as a non-steam game, or have steam running while you play. just tested.
